basics.name: Dan Kaplun
basics.summary: I make computers do cool things for a living. Hire me!

work.summary: Deep web scraping and sentiment analysis [Stack: Python (Django), CentOS]
highlights: Migrated from regular expression-based scraping to true HTML parsing

work.summary: Search engine platform with emphasis on fuzzy matching [Stack: Python (Django), JavaScript (jQuery), AWS (Amazon Linux on EC2, RDS, S3, etc.)]
highlights: Maintainer of service and code for largest client
Implemented role-based administration tool built on top of Django
Redesigned search interface; introduced criteria prioritization

work.summary: Social media marketing startup; agile, test-driven philosophy [Stack: Python (Django, mod_python), JavaScript (jQuery, Prototype), MySQL, Apache, Ubuntu]
highlights: Automated Facebook tab administration using Graph API
Seamless video uploading using Vimeo's Advanced API and YouTube's Data API
Robust voting API using Facebook authentication

education.area: PSEOP: aced graduate-level math courses while enrolled in high school
PSEOP: exhausted course catalog in math
Top 10 graduate; summa cum laude; with honors

awards.title: Annual CSU Freshman-Sophomore Mathematics Competition
awards.summary: 1st Place while still attending high school

references.name: Jason Brodsky-Porges (Product Manager at Offerpop)
references.reference: I had the pleasure to work with Dan Kaplun at Offerpop, where I was the Product Manager for our team. He was a very respected coworker who brought many desirable attributes. He was a very friendly coworker as well as a great communicator who was willing to walk other members of his team through the technology stack in order to get everyone up to speed efficiently on many occasions. He grasped concepts and ideas quickly and was able to efficiently implement them into our technology. I believe you will find Dan to be an excellent web developer and a strong contributor to your organization.
